fields.summary: Building the mobile app should set the analytics deploy type from the selected environment

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
With the introduction of VPC environments, Studio might pass in the VPC cluster environment name as the deploy-type, to channel the analytics events for a specific server.

One of the use case is that the user might want to package the app with their STAGING server environment, so that while testing their package app, they would like to receive the analytics even on their staging server, instead of production server.

So, CLI might need to add an additional argument (similar to '--build-type') to take any VPC environment name and set the analytics handler in the SDK. If this argument is not set during the build command, then CLI should fall back to using --deploy-type to assign the analytics environment type.
fields.summary: Add argument to accept analytics deploy type
Android: Create --build-type in CLI and integrate it with the sdk

comments.body: One of the possible new flag name to set is '--build-type', to carry the environment name to SDK.

Tested the following command
{code}
ti build -p ios -T device --build-type abc123
{code}
h5. Actual result
{code}
"--log-level" "trace" "--build-type" "abc123" "--device-id" "itunes"
{code}

Environment:
Mac osx 10.9.3 Mavericks
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201405271647
Titanium SDK, build: 3.3.0.v20140530112513 
Node.JS Version: v0.10.13 
NPM Version: 1.3.2 
acs@1.0.14 
alloy@1.4.0-beta 
npm@1.3.2 
titanium@3.3.0-beta 
titanium-code-processor@1.1.1
